clinical_study.brief_title: Short-term Existential Behavioural Therapy for Informal Caregivers of Palliative Patients: a Randomised Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Short-term Existential Behavioural Therapy for Informal Caregivers of Palliative Patients: a Randomised Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to test the effectiveness of a short-term manualised individual psychotherapy, called Existential Behavioural Therapy (EBT), to prevent depression in informal caregivers of palliative patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators have developed and pilot-tested a short-term manualised individual psychotherapy, called Existential Behavioural Therapy (EBT), to reduce psychological distress in informal caregivers of palliative patients. The investigators propose to conduct a two-arm randomised controlled trial (RCT) to test the effectiveness of EBT against usual care for the reduction of distress and the promotion of quality of life.
Two one-to-one manualised psychotherapeutic sessions will be compared to a treatment-as-usual control group.Treatment-as-usual includes two supportive sessions.
The design will be an unblinded RCT consisting of two conditions (EBT and Treatment-as-usual), with assessment at pre- and post-treatment and follow-ups at four weeks and six months. The trial will take place in the Clinic of Palliative Care, University of Munich (Klinik und Poliklinik für Palliativmedizin der LMU München).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment; 4 weeks follow-up; 6 months follow-up
primary_outcome.description: A reliable and valid 9-item measure of depression

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive and Negative Affect Scale (PANAS; Watson et al., 1988)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment; 4 weeks follow-up; 6 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: two mood scales, one that measures positive affect and the other which measures negative affect

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with Life Scale (SWLS; Diener et al., 1985)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment; 4 weeks follow-up; 6 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: a short 5-item instrument designed to measure global cognitive judgments of satisfaction with life

secondary_outcome.measure: World Health Organisation Quality-of-Life Scale (WHOQOL-BREF; Angermeyer et al., 2000)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment; 4 weeks follow-up; 6 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: an abbreviated 26-item generic Quality of Life Scale developed through the World Health Organisation measuring physical health, psychological health, social relationships, and environment

secondary_outcome.measure: Numeric rating scale for mental stress and quality of life (NRS, range 0-10)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment; 4 weeks follow-up; 6 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: a numeric scale used for the subjective measurement of mental stress and quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Generalised Anxiety Disorders-7 (GAD-7; Spitzer et al., 2006)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment; 4 weeks follow-up; 6 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: a 7-item self-report measure designed to screen and assess the severity of generalised anxiety disorder symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Fragebogen zur Inanspruchnahme medizinischer und nicht-medizinischer Versorgungsleistungen im Alter (FIMA; Seidl et al., 2014)
secondary_outcome.description: a german questionnaire for health-related resource use

secondary_outcome.measure: German version of the NCCN distress-thermometer (Mehnert et al., 2005)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment; 4 weeks follow-up; 6 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: a subjective measurement of distress on a 0-10 scale

secondary_outcome.measure: General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12, Goldberg et al., 1972)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Post-treatment; 4 weeks follow-up; 6 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: a 12-item self-report measure of psychological morbidity

intervention.description: participants assigned to the intervention arm will receive 2 manualised therapy sessions with focus on mindfulness and activating resources delivered by trained therapists at the Clinic of Palliative Care
participants assigned to the treatment-as-usual arm will receive 2 supportive sessions delivered by trained therapists at the Clinic of Palliative Care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥ 21 years of age
- informal caregivers of palliative patients at last stage of life and during bereavement;
- fluent German language skills
Exclusion Criteria:
- psychiatric conditions such as schizophrenic disorder, psychotic disorder etc.;
- pronounced cognitive impairment e.g. delirium, dementia
